title: Manual for Educators: Multilingualism in early childhood education and care
shortDescription: This pedagogical manual offers detailed game instructions, methodological approaches and practical daily-nursery activities designed to promote multilingual awareness and communication among young children in early childhood settings.

title: European portfolio for pre-primary educators: The plurilingual and intercultural dimension
shortDescription: This professional-reflection portfolio provides pre-primary educators with structured descriptors and self-assessment tasks to support their work in environments of linguistic and cultural diversity.
source: European Centre for Modern Languages (ECML) of the Council of Europe

title: 20 things you might not know about birthday traditions around the world
shortDescription: This infographic poster offers a visual exploration of diverse birthday traditions from multiple cultures, supporting learners’ intercultural awareness by highlighting how celebration rituals vary across linguistic and cultural contexts.
source: European Centre for Modern Languages (ECML) of the Council of Europe

title: Young children's language learning pathways – Making early language learning visible
shortDescription: This project-resource offers tools and methods for educators to document, observe and support young children’s language learning journeys (ages 3-12) in multilingual settings, thereby helping make early language development more visible and integrated into practice.
source: European Centre for Modern Languages (ECML) of the Council of Europe

title: Lara's language journey across Europe
shortDescription: A visually-rich and multilingual booklet designed for young children, this resource follows “Lara” exploring the languages of Europe, helping learners engage with language diversity through story, stickers, sound files and interactive activities, suitable for ages 3-6.
source: European Centre for Modern Languages (ECML) of the Council of Europe

title: Emergent multilingual literacy in early childhood education and care
shortDescription: This article argues for integrating children’s home languages into early literacy education to promote positive identity, confidence and multilingual literacy development in preschool settings (ages 0-6).

title: PALINGUI-Young Children's Language Learning Pathways
shortDescription: PALINGUI (Young Children's Language Learning Pathways), an ongoing initiative of the European Centre for Modern Languages (ECML), provides tools to support teachers and educators in reflecting on the language learning pathways of children aged 3-12 years and making this progress visible. The project offers methods and examples of inspiring practice to guide teachers in choosing appropriate teaching strategies and involving children in the process of making their own language learning visible. PALINGUI identifies key principles for understanding, supporting, and showing language learning through observation, assessment, and documentation
source: European Centre for Modern Languages (ECML) of the Council of Europe

title: COMPARE project resources
shortDescription: COMPARE - Collaboration with parents and Multiliteracy in early Childhood Education. The project examined, firstly, the ways in which educators, parents and children engaged in literacy activities and adults established home-centre collaboration and, secondly, the influence of the literacy and collaborative practices on attitudes and engagement.

title: MuLiPEC project resources
shortDescription: MuLiPEC – Developing multilingual pedagogies in Early Childhood. The aims of the research project consisted of analysing the influence of the PD on the practitioners’ attitudes, knowledge, and practices; comparing practices across settings; and investigating the influence of multilingual practices on children.

title: AGENTIVE project
focusArea: Language awareness, Intercultural awareness and understanding, Early Literacy Skills

title: "Babo the Dragon"
shortDescription: "Babo the Dragon" is an activity book that teaches children between 2 and 5 years old their first words in English in a natural way while playing and having fun. The activities proposed by "Babo" are very varied and focus on curiosity, psychomotricity, coordination, creativity, personal hygiene etc., and many other skills. All the cards contain instructions, but you can also create a different activity or game with them.

title: Read with MEE project resources
shortDescription: This project represents a cutting-edge Erasmus+ project running from 2023 to 2026 that specifically addresses the achievement gap between monolingual and multilingual children. Coordinated by Mercator European Research Centre in collaboration with partners from the Netherlands, Belgium, Ireland, and Spain, the project promotes dialogic reading approaches and home language inclusion during book reading activities. Key outputs include the Handbook-INC: Inclusive Multiliteracy Development for All, which provides best practices and recent research developments; video series showing best practices across Europe and explaining key concepts; an online library with inclusive multilingual books; a community platform for practitioners; and a "referatory" connecting relevant projects, publications, and experts. The project takes a holistic approach by working across ECEC centres, libraries, and home environments, allowing children to develop positive attitudes toward linguistic diversity.
typology: Instructional materials (teaching and learning), "Reference materials (pedagogical guides, training materials)"

title: PEPELINO portfolio
shortDescription: PEPELINO (European Portfolio for Pre-primary Educators), is an ECML initiative that provides a comprehensive catalogue of competences required by teachers of young learners, adapted from the European Portfolio for Student Teachers of Languages (EPOSTL). This resource enables pre-primary educators to reflect on their didactic competences and professional development needs in supporting early language acquisition.
source: European Centre for Modern Languages (ECML) of the Council of Europe

title: Early Literacy Guide for Caregivers and Educators
shortDescription: Openly accessible guide and videos to build early literacy skills from birth, focusing on talk, reading, and play.
typology: Instructional materials (teaching and learning), Simulations & games

title: 10 Ways to Support Your Child's Literacy at Home
shortDescription: A guide for parents to engage young children in literacy activities at home

title: Embracing linguistic diversity to support multilingual learners
shortDescription: This article outlines strategies for early childhood educators to honour children’s home languages, engage families, and create inclusive classrooms where multilingualism is valued, thus enhancing intercultural awareness and understanding.
focusArea: Plurilingual competence, Intercultural awareness and understanding
source: National Association for the Education of Young Children
